## StraightSegment.pointAlongPathFrom() method

returns the point on the segment's path that is 'distance' along the length of the path from 'location', where 'location' is a decimal from 0 to 1 inclusive, and 'distance' is a number of pixels. this hands off to jsPlumbUtil to do the maths, supplying two points and the distance.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
pointAlongPathFrom(location: number, distance: number, absolute?: boolean): PointXY;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  location | number |  |
|  distance | number |  |
|  absolute | boolean |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

PointXY
